title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 79.24 - Wrecked or disabled aircraft to be removed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 79.24 - Wrecked or disabled aircraft to be removed

State Regulations

The owner of a wrecked or disabled aircraft shall at his
sole expense be responsible and solely liable for the removal of the said
aircraft and parts thereof as directed by the airport operator, but shall not
begin such removal without the written permission of the airport operator. In
the event of failure to comply with such direction, such wrecked or disabled
aircraft and parts may be removed by the airport operator at the aircraft
owner's expense. The airport operator shall have no liability for damage or
loss which may occur in the course of any aircraft removal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
79.24

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
